posts.post_content: When it comes to two drop counters, this is one of the best. Obviously [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak) is more useful in most formats, and [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) is virtually strictly better at times, but this is definitely not a bad counter, and has advantages over both.

posts.post_content: While it's disappointing to see [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak) leave Standard, that may not necessarily be a bad thing. If you pass the turn with two mana open, your opponent is even less sure what you have in your hand, potentially making him or her more willing to take a chance and play something you can counter.
posts.html:
While it's disappointing to see Mana Leak leave Standard, that may not necessarily be a bad thing. If you pass the turn with two mana open, your opponent is even less sure what you have in your hand, potentially making him or her more willing to take a chance and play something you can counter.
